A Step by Step Guide To Performing First Aid

Once confident that you can enter the scene without harm, obtain consent from the victim: Tell the person your name
 Describe your level of training and what you think is wrong
 Tell what you plan to do and ask for permission to provide care
 Use sample questions to gather more info : allergies, medications, medical history etc.
 Contact head to toe check: Check head, neck, shoulders, chest, abdomen,
 arms, and hands for injury
Step 2: If the person is awake and responsive and there is no severe bleeding

Shout to get the attention of the person
 If there is no response, tap their shoulder
 Check for normal breathing
 Check for Responsiveness and normal breathing for no more than 5 seconds
Step 3: If the Person Appears UNRESPONSIVE

Send someone to call 911 or the designated emergency number and obtain an AED and first aid kit
 Keep gathering info from bystanders using the sample questions listed before
 Conduct head to toe check
 Roll the person onto his or her side into a recovery position if there are no obvious signs of injury
Step 4: If the Person is Breathing

Send someone to call 911 or the designated emergency number and obtain AED and first aid kit
 Ensure the person is face up firm on a flat surface such as the floor or ground
 Begin CPR or use an AED if one is immediately available, if trained in doing so
 Continue administering CPR until the person exhibits signs of life, such as breathing
 Otherwise wait for EMS or trained medical responders arrive to the scene
Note:Stop CPR if scene becomes unsafe or you cannot continue CPR due to exhuastion
